item.title: Rising Tension Seen in North Korea and at Sea Border
item.description: South Korea’s intelligence chief said the North had increased weapons near a disputed border, in what analysts said might be an attempt to divert attention from an internal power struggle.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: Jang Song-thaek, the uncle of Kim Jong-un, was said to have been ousted.

item.title: N. Korea Says It Has Released Veteran It Held After Visit
item.description: Merrill Newman did top-secret work as an Army intelligence officer during the Korean War. On a return visit to the North this fall, he was accused of war crimes and held, then released.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By BARRY BEARAK and CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:credit: Kcna, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Merrill Newman reading an “apology” last week.

item.title: The Lede: Latest Updates on Mourning for Mandela
item.description: The Lede continues to follow the global reaction to the death of Nelson Mandela, on a day of tributes to the man who led the emancipation of South Africa from white minority rule and then served as its first freely elected president.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: 6 Arrested in Theft of Truck With Radioactive Waste
item.description: Government officials said the people checked into a hospital not far from the central Mexican town where a stolen truck carrying radioactive cobalt 60 was found abandoned.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD and PAULINA VILLEGAS

item.title: An Assist for Weinstein’s ‘Mandela’
item.description: Harvey Weinstein, a master at building buzz around his movies, walks a fine line in publicizing his new film, “Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom.”
item.dc:creator: By BROOKS BARNES
item.media:description: Idris Elba, left, and Tony Kgoroge in the new "Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom."

item.title: Hagel Seeks to Assure Gulf Allies of U.S. Commitment
item.description: The defense secretary said that the Pentagon would not reduce its military deployments to the region or its focus on countering shared security threats.
item.dc:creator: By THOM SHANKER

item.title: The Saturday Profile: A Leader in Mao’s Cultural Revolution Faces His Past
item.description: Chen Xiaolu’s public apology for persecutions nearly 50 years ago has raised hopes that China might finally be ready to face its dark past.
item.dc:creator: By JANE PERLEZ
item.media:credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times
item.media:description: Chen Xiaolu, a former Red Guard and the youngest son of civil war and Sino-Japanese war hero Marshal Chen Yi, at his home in Beijing.

item.title: Nuns, Missing in Syria, Resurface in Video
item.description: The nuns, who had vanished from the ancient Aramaic-speaking town of Maaloula, said they had left with rebels to escape shelling.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD

item.title: The Lede: Updates: First Reactions to the Death of Nelson Mandela
item.description: South Africans, world leaders and citizens of many nations reacted to the death of Nelson Mandela on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Behind Scenes, Ukraine’s Rich and Powerful Battle Over the Future
item.description: Protesters may be staging anti-government rallies, but behind the scenes an equally fierce tug-of-war is being waged among a small group of ultra-wealthy businessmen.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Petro Poroshenko, a shipping, confectionery and agriculture magnate is among the most pro-Western of the oligarchs.

item.title: Lens Blog: Raising Coca and Hopes in Bolivia
item.description: Marcelo Pérez del Carpio returned to the Bolivian countryside to find migrants and peasants abandoning traditional crops for the promise of quick cash with coca.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID GONZALEZ
item.media:description: Maria, left, Andreina, center, and Julia prepared lunches to sell in the morning. Residents of Challa sometimes complement their incomes by selling supplies along the road.

item.title: 6 Detained in Mexico Theft of Radioactive Material
item.description: Six people being tested for possible radiation exposure in a hospital in central Mexico are suspects in the theft of highly radioactive cobalt-60, a government official said Friday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Mandela’s Death Stirs Sense of Loss Around the World
item.description: As President Jacob Zuma announced a week of ceremonies, an outpouring of praise came from presidential offices, a prison, and from the streets.
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH, LYDIA POLGREEN and ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: People sang songs of struggle outside the late South African president's home.

item.title: Reactions to Mandela’s Death
item.description: Notable figures and Times readers share their perspectives.

item.title: Generation Born After Apartheid Sees Mandela’s Fight as History
item.description: Those born after apartheid’s end say their determination to look to the future and not the past is the greatest tribute they can pay Nelson Mandela.
item.dc:creator: By MARCUS MABRY
item.media:description: Nokuthula Magubane, 18, belongs to a generation known as the born frees because they were born after the end of apartheid, or just before it ended.

item.title: Colin Eglin, White Opponent to Apartheid, Dies at 88
item.description: Mr. Eglin, a South African politician, was at the forefront of his country’s white, liberal opposition to apartheid and helped draft the Constitution that ended it in 1993.
item.dc:creator: By PAUL VITELLO
item.media:description: Colin Eglin, head of South Africa's Progressive Federal Party, toasted his supporters in Cape Town in 1977.

item.title: Pro-Government Ukrainians Take to Streets to Denounce European Social Values
item.description: Orthodox Christians who oppose European integration marched through the capital to denounce homosexuality, which they said would accompany a closer European alliance.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Chinese Police Recommend Trial for Rights Advocate
item.description: The advocate, Xu Zhiyong, helped organize demonstrations demanding that the Communist Party disclose officials’ wealth and provide equal educational opportunities.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Where Mandela Once Boxed, Men Fill Days Lifting Weights
item.description: The Soweto gym where Nelson Mandela trained in the 1950s is now a YMCA that has been newly renovated and is a haven for some men who are struggling to find work.
item.dc:creator: By RICK LYMAN

item.title: Listening Post: Biden Finds Political Instincts Handy in Asia
item.description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. honed his political instincts over the decades, and they came in handy on a trip to Asia this week.
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: December 6
item.description: Mr. Mandela, 95, died in Johannesburg, South Africa, after a long illness.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Schoolchildren in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, paying tribute to Nelson Mandela, former South African president, who passed away in Johannesburg, on Thursday.

item.title: The Lede: Students Use Twitter to Remember American Teacher Killed in Libya
item.description: After an American teacher was killed in Libya, his students recalled how he would joke with them online.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER and JENNIFER PRESTON

item.title: Kerry, Invoking Mandela, Says Peace in Mideast Is Possible
item.description: “We are closer than we have been in years” to an agreement between Israel and the Palestinians, Secretary of State John Kerry said, without citing specific examples.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and JODI RUDOREN

item.title: India Ink: Seemandhra Region of Andhra Pradesh Shuts Down After Cabinet Passes Telangana Blueprint
item.description: Political and union leaders called for an indefinite strike to protest the Indian cabinet’s approval of a plan to create a new state out of Andhra Pradesh.
item.dc:creator: By SRIRAM KARRI
item.media:description: Supporters of Telangana Rashtra Samithi protesting at a demonstration in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, on Wednesday.

item.title: For Mandela, Reverence, but Criticism, Too
item.description: Nelson Mandela was almost worshiped by many for his role in installing multiracial democracy, but political observers say he was never above reproach.
item.dc:creator: By RICK LYMAN
item.media:description: A man lights a candle outside Mr. Mandela's former home in Soweto, now a museum.
